item.title: 美国 7 月份建筑支出降幅超过预期
item.description: 由于抵押贷款增加和供应增加拖累了单户住宅建设，7 月份美国建筑支出降幅超过预期。【原文：U.S. construction spending fell more than expected in July as higher mortgages and increased supply weighed on single-family homebuilding.】

item.title: 8 月份美国制造业从 8 个月低点回升，但趋势依然疲软
item.description: 由于就业情况有所改善，上个月美国制造业指数从 7 月份的八个月低点略有回升，但总体趋势仍表明工厂活动低迷。【原文：A gauge of U.S. manufacturing edged up last month from an eight-month low in July amid some improvement in employment, but the overall trend continued to point to subdued factory activity.】

item.title: 星座品牌公司将记录高达 25 亿美元的葡萄酒业务相关费用
item.description: 科罗娜（Corona）啤酒制造商星座品牌（Constellation Brands）周二表示，在经历了几个季度的美国需求疲软之后，该公司将减记葡萄酒和烈酒业务的价值，并在本季度计提高达 25 亿美元的费用。【原文：Constellation Brands will write down the value of its wine and spirits business and take up to a $2.5 billion charge in the current quarter, the Corona beer maker said on Tuesday, following several quarters of weak demand in the U.S.】

item.title: 高盛暂时停止对锌的报道
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）"暂时 "停止了对锌市场的投资，理由是今年早些时候锌行业主管离职后 "能力受限"。【原文：Goldman Sachs has suspended covering zinc markets "for the moment", citing "restricted capacity" following the departure of the sector lead earlier this year.】

item.title: 信中称 Glas Trust 可能无权在 Byju 破产案中代表美国贷款人行事
item.description: 总部位于美国的格拉斯信托公司（Glas Trust）在一封信中表示，该公司的法院指定官员可能无权代表贷款人，这些贷款人正在破产程序中向印度教育科技巨头 Byju's 寻求超过 10 亿美元的贷款。【原文：U.S.-based Glas Trust may not have the authority to represent lenders who are seeking more than $1 billion from Indian ed-tech giant Byju's under an insolvency process, the court-appointed officer running the company said in a letter.】

item.title: 巴西 HBR 房地产公司对 WeWork 提起驱逐诉讼
item.description: 巴西房地产公司 HBR Realty 在周二提交的一份证券文件中称，由于未收到付款，该公司已对灵活工作空间提供商 WeWork 提起驱逐诉讼。【原文：Brazilian real estate firm HBR Realty has filed an eviction action against flexible workspace provider WeWork due to lack of payment, HBR said in a securities filing on Tuesday.】

item.title: 从和平缔造者到禁忌破坏者，大众汽车老板布卢姆与工会斗智斗勇
item.description: 大众汽车老板奥利弗-布卢姆（Oliver Blume）已经在与电动汽车需求放缓和中国竞争对手作斗争，现在他必须放下团队合作的架子，去对付另一个强劲的对手--德国强大的工会。【原文：Volkswagen boss Oliver Blume, already battling slowing demand for electric cars and Chinese rivals, must now put aside his mantle as team player to tackle yet another tough opponent, Germany's powerful labour unions.】

item.title: 穆迪将全球再保险公司的展望从稳定上调至积极
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）在周二的一份声明中表示，由于再保险公司的价格上涨、政策更加严格以及投资收益健康，该公司将全球再保险公司的评级展望从稳定上调至积极。【原文：Moody's Ratings upgraded its outlook on global reinsurers to positive from stable owing to reinsurers' higher prices and more restrictive policies, along with healthy investment income, the ratings agency said in a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: 尽管降息，加拿大房价仍将因需求低迷而小幅上涨：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社（Reuters）调查的分析师称，尽管预期会有更多次降息，但加拿大的房价在 2024 年将几乎不会上涨，在未来几年也只会小幅上涨。【原文：Home prices in Canada will barely rise in 2024 and only modestly in coming years despite expectations for many more interest rate cuts, with affordability improving but remaining stretched, according to analysts polled by Reuters.】

item.title: 游戏开发商育碧因《星球大战外传》反响平平而业绩下滑
item.description: 法国视频游戏制造商育碧（Ubisoft）周二股价连续第二天下跌，原因是该公司最近推出的两款游戏表现低迷，其中包括期待已久的《星球大战外传》（Star Wars Outlaws）。【原文：Shares in French video game maker Ubisoft fell on Tuesday for a second consecutive day following a sluggish performance of its two recent releases, including the long-awaited "Star Wars Outlaws".】

item.title: Airbnb 要求纽约市重新考虑短租法规
item.description: Airbnb 周二要求纽约市重新考虑将于 2023 年 9 月生效的短租法规，理由是旅客价格上涨和对住房市场的影响为零。【原文：Airbnb on Tuesday asked New York City to reconsider regulations on short-term rentals that went into effect in September 2023, citing higher prices for travelers and zero impact on the housing market.】

item.title: 诺基亚败给爱立信后与 AT&T 签订光纤协议
item.description: 美国电信运营商AT&T和芬兰网络设备制造商诺基亚周二表示，双方已签署协议在美国建设光纤网络。【原文：U.S. telecoms operator AT&T and Finnish network equipment maker Nokia have signed an agreement to build a fibre network in the U.S., the Finnish company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 电动汽车公司 Polestar 聘用前 Stellantis 财务主管担任首席财务官
item.description: 电动汽车制造商 Polestar 周二表示，公司已任命前 Stellantis 财务主管 Jean-Francois Mady 担任首席财务官，此前几天，公司更换了长期首席执行官 Thomas Ingenlath。【原文：Electric vehicle maker Polestar said on Tuesday it has appointed former Stellantis finance executive Jean-Francois Mady as its CFO, days after replacing long-time CEO Thomas Ingenlath.】

item.title: 期货下跌，市场为数据密集的一周做好准备
item.description: 周二，美国股指期货走低，因为在本周即将公布的一系列经济数据报告之前，市场普遍持谨慎态度，这些数据可能会影响美联储今年放松货币政策的程度。【原文：U.S. stock index futures traded lower on Tuesday as caution prevailed ahead of a slew of economic data reports due through the week that could influence the extent of monetary policy easing by the Federal Reserve this year.】

item.title: 早报劳动节到劳动报告，九月份拉开序幕
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 药品价格谈判后，美国仍将支付至少两倍的费用
item.description: 路透社的一项调查发现，美国政府首次谈判达成的处方药价格仍是其他四个高收入国家药品生产商同意价格的平均两倍多，在某些情况下甚至是五倍。【原文：The U.S. government's first-ever negotiated prices for prescription drugs are still on average more than double, and in some cases five times, what drugmakers have agreed to in four other high-income countries, a Reuters review has found.】

item.title: 陷入困境的芯片制造商股价暴跌，英特尔的道指地位受到威胁
item.description: 在 1999 年的互联网时代，英特尔和微软是最早加入道琼斯工业平均指数的两家科技公司之一。现在，其股价的下滑可能会使这家美国芯片制造商失去在蓝筹股指数中的地位。【原文：Intel was one of the first two tech companies to join the Dow Jones Industrial Average during 1999's dot-com era, along with Microsoft. Now, a slump in its share price could cost the American chipmaker its place in the blue-chip index.】

item.title: 美联储决策者一致认为需要降息，但理由各不相同
item.description: 就在两个半月前，大多数美国央行行长还认为在 9 月 17-18 日的会议上不会降息。【原文：As recently as two and a half months ago, most U.S. central bankers didn't see an interest rate cut in the cards at their Sept. 17-18 meeting.】

item.title: 跨山石油管道扩建迫使竞争对手暂时降低费率
item.description: 由于新扩建的跨山输油管道的竞争日趋激烈，历史上向美国输送加拿大原油的输油管道正在削减费率，并寻求输送不同等级的原油。【原文：Pipelines that historically carry Canadian crude to the U.S. are cutting rates and looking to ship different grades of crude oil due to rising competition from the newly expanded Trans Mountain pipeline.】

item.title: 德国哪些大众工厂可能受到裁员影响？
item.description: 大众汽车表示，由于面临来自亚洲竞争对手的压力，公司计划终止其就业保障计划--该计划自 1994 年开始实施，可在 2029 年前防止裁员。【原文：Volkswagen said it plans to end its job security programme -- which has been in place since 1994 and prevents job cuts until 2029 -- as it faces pressure from Asian competitors.】

item.title: 日经新闻》称，苹果公司将从 2025 年起全面改用 OLED 作为 iPhone 显示屏
item.description: 日经商业日报》称，苹果公司将在 2025 年及以后销售的所有 iPhone 机型上使用有机发光二极管（OLED）显示屏，完全摒弃液晶显示屏（LCD）。【原文：Apple will use organic light-emitting diode (OLED) displays for all iPhone models sold in 2025 and afterwards, moving completely away from liquid crystal displays (LCDs), Nikkei business daily said.】

item.title: LVMH 旗下迪奥招聘 Miu Miu 首席执行官担任总经理
item.description: 路威酩轩集团（LVMH）旗下克里斯汀-迪奥（Christian Dior）高级定制时装品牌周二表示，已聘请普拉达（Prada）旗下快速发展的 Miu Miu 品牌首席执行官贝内德塔-佩特鲁佐（Benedetta Petruzzo）担任总经理。【原文：Christian Dior Couture has recruited Benedetta Petruzzo, the CEO of Prada's fast growing Miu Miu label, as its managing director, the LVMH-owned brand said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 欧盟最高法院支持 Illumina 对抗欧盟对 Grail 交易的调查
item.description: 欧洲最高法院周二支持美国基因测序公司 Illumina 对抗欧盟反垄断监管机构对其 71 亿美元收购癌症诊断测试制造商 Grail 的调查。【原文：Europe's top court on Tuesday backed U.S. gene sequencing company Illumina's fight against EU antitrust regulators' investigation into its $7.1 billion bid for cancer diagnostic test maker Grail .】

item.title: 2024 年旅游业对全球 GDP 的贡献将达到创纪录的 11 万亿美元
item.description: 根据非营利性会员组织世界旅行和旅游理事会（World Travel and Tourism Council）的年度报告，2024 年全球每 10 美元的消费中将有 1 美元用于旅游，因为人们会抓紧时间预订酒店、游轮和航班。【原文：A record $1 out of every $10 spent globally in 2024 will be on travel as people briskly book hotels, cruises and flights, according to an annual report by the World Travel and Tourism Council, a non-profit membership organization.】

item.title: 日经新闻》称，贝恩向 KKR 提出 41 亿美元的还价，反对其对富士软的收购要约
item.description: 据《日经商业日报》周二报道，美国收购基金贝恩资本（Bain Capital）已提出还价，希望以约6000亿日元（约合41.0亿美元）的价格收购日本富士软公司，比美国私募股权公司KKR的出价高出约5%。【原文：U.S. buyout fund Bain Capital has made a counter-offer to take over Japan's Fuji Soft for about 600 billion yen ($4.10 billion), or about 5% higher than U.S. private equity firm KKR's bid, the Nikkei business daily reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 国泰航空为检查 A350 停飞航班，其他航空公司等待指示
item.description: 香港国泰航空公司（Cathay Pacific Airways）表示，在本周一一架空客A350喷气机的发动机部件在飞行中发生故障后，该公司正在检查其所有的空客A350喷气机，但其他航空公司尚未接到检查类似发动机的指示。【原文：Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways is inspecting all of its Airbus A350 jets after the in-flight failure of an engine part on Monday, but other airlines have not yet been issued instructions to examine similar engines, carriers said.】

item.title: 沃尔沃卡车公司将推出续航 600 公里的电动卡车
item.description: 瑞典沃尔沃公司（Volvo）卡车制造部门周二表示，该公司将推出 FH 电动卡车的长程车型，一次充电可行驶 600 公里（373 英里）。【原文：Sweden's Volvo will launch a long-range variant of its FH Electric truck, capable of covering up to 600 km (373 miles) on a single charge, its truckmaking arm said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特斯拉 8 月份在华销量创下今年最佳纪录
item.description: 8 月份，特斯拉在中国的销量创下了今年迄今为止最好的一个月，这家美国电动汽车制造商从较小城市的畅销中获益匪浅。【原文：Tesla's sales in China logged their best month for the year so far in August, with the U.S. electric vehicle maker benefiting from brisk sales in smaller cities.】

item.title: Cryptoverse：比特币 ETF 迈出 500 亿美元的小步，走向大时代
item.description: 去年 10 月，马修-侯根（Matthew Hougan）在一个行业小组会议上表示，他预计现货比特币交易所交易基金（ETF）将在头五年吸引 550 亿美元的资产。【原文：Last October, Matthew Hougan told an industry panel that he expected spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) to attract $55 billion of assets in their first five years.】

item.title: 泰国总理表示，泰国价值 130 亿美元的数字施舍计划将包括现金支付
item.description: 泰国总理白通丹-西那瓦周二表示，政府吹嘘的 4,500 亿泰铢（约合 131 亿美元）"数字钱包 "拨款的一部分将以现金形式发放，这是其民粹主义旗舰政策的又一变化。【原文：Thailand's Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra on Tuesday said part of the government's vaunted 450 billion baht ($13.1 billion) "digital wallet" handout will be distributed in cash, in another change to its flagship populist policy.】
